intro: Licaria jamaicensis, commonly known as the Jamaican licaria, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region, particularly Jamaica and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
